Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Demeanor \De*mean"or\, n. [Written also {demeanour}.] [For demeanure, fr. demean. See {Demean}, v. t.] 1. Management; treatment; conduct. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
God commits the managing so great a trust . . . wholly to the demeanor of every grown man. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. Behavior; deportment; carriage; bearing; mien. [1913 Webster]
His demeanor was singularly pleasing. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
The men, as usual, liked her artless kindness and simple refined demeanor. --Thackeray. [1913 Webster]
demeanor n : (behavioral attributes) the way a person behaves toward other people [syn: {demeanour}, {behavior}, {behaviour}, {conduct}, {deportment}]
